data.text:
Named after Princess Elena of Montenegro (1873-1952) who later became Queen of Italy (1900-1946), Amaro Montenegro has been made in Bologna since 1885. It is a wonderful liqueur in the amaro or bitters family which immediately reminds us of cola. Next are notes of vanilla, dried orange peel, jasmine, rose and sweet licorice. Its bitterness comes from wormwood, the same herb in absinthe, and other herbs; it is at first subtle but pleasantly lingers. Amaro Montenegro is a great introduction to the world of bitters for those who might find the flavors of Fernet Branca or even Campari too aggressive. While it is easy to classify Amaro Montenegro as mild, it has remained popular for over a century due to its fine balance of soft and bracing flavors.

Our MonteCola cocktail highlights the spirit’s predominant cola flavor by mixing it simply with lime seltzer and serving it in a pony Coca-Cola bottle.

• 2.25 fl oz (1.5 shots) Amaro Montenegro

• 4.75 fl oz lime-flavored seltzer water, chilled

• 1 empty pony (7 fl oz / 207 mL) Coca-Cola bottle

Pour the Montenegro into the bottle followed by the seltzer. Carefully mix the two with a straw before serving.
